quest.name: Duty, Honor, Country
journal: Momodi wishes to enlist the aid of a trusted friend of Ul'dah.

Having sworn you to secrecy, Momodi reveals that the royal crown has been stolen. According to her, if the theft were to be made public, it would tarnish the sultana's reputation. She suspects that the missive which Fufulupa found amongst Baldewyn's possessions was written by the perpetrators of this crime. Momodi bids you bear the letter to its intended recipient, Owyne of the Sultansworn, and offer your assistance.

Owyne confirms that the letter is a ransom note from the thieves, stating their demands for the return of the crown. Believing there to be no other way, the guilt-ridden Sultansworn decides to give the criminals what they want. Rendezvous with him at the Unholy Heir in central Thanalan and ensure the exchange goes as planned.
Having taken receipt of their payment, the thieves rather predictably attempt to murder you, but with the aid of Papashan and a band of Sultansworn, you defeat them.

After the Sultansworn leave, you find yourself alone with the masked mage who orchestrated the theft, and another battle ensues. Fortunately, Thancred comes to your aid, and together you emerge triumphant. Though the motives of this “Ascian” remain a mystery, his schemes now lie in ruin. Return to the Heart of the Sworn and find out if the Sultansworn have recovered the crown.

The sultana visits the Heart of the Sworn to thank you personally for helping to recover the crown, and to request your presence at the forthcoming banquet as her guest of honor. Though her gesture leaves you speechless, you gather your composure and accept, already looking forward to your next meeting.
objectives: Rendezvous with Owyne at the Unholy Heir.
Speak with Papashan in the Heart of the Sworn.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Can I count on your discretion, Forename? If so, then listen closely...

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: The outside world believes Ul'dah to be a sultanate, ruled by Sultana Nanamo Ul Namo. Truth is, though, it's the six wealthiest citizens that hold the most sway─the Syndicate.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Be that as it may, the sultana's still got the support of the people...

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: But she might struggle to keep even that if a certain incident becomes public knowledge.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: It pains me to say it, but Her Grace's crown, the symbol of the royal dynasty, has been stolen.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: And Owyne...Owyne's the Sultansworn who was charged with guardin' it that night.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: I'd bet anythin' this letter was written by the bastards who made off with the crown.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: It can't be a coincidence that a man we know to have been fraternizin' with thieves had a letter for Owyne of all people, at this of all times.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: You need to take this to the man himself, Forename. Tell him Momodi sent you, and that it concerns a lost heirloom.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: If it looks as though the fellow needs help, I want you to lend it to him. The future of our fair city may depend on it.

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORMA
dialogue.text: The Heart of the Sworn lies beyond. State your business.

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORMA
dialogue.text: ...Pardon? Did you say a lost heirloom? Ahem. Proceed.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed into the Heart of the Sworn?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORMA
dialogue.text: What are you playing at, adventurer? Did Momodi truly send you? If this is some sort of prank, there will be consequences!

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Well met, adventurer. What business brings you here this day?

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: ...A letter? Very well, let's see it.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: ...Have you read this, adventurer?

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: I see. But you have some inkling as to its contents, I think.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Mistress Momodi has doubtless explained to you the significance of the crown, and what its loss could mean for Her Grace the sultana... <sigh> This theft shames the Sultansworn─and me most of all.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: The blame is mine, you see. I grew lax in my duties, and in a moment of carelessness...

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text:
No, it will do no good to recount the tale now.
Since the hour of the theft, we've searched frantically for any signs, any whispers as to the whereabouts of the crown. We have found nothing.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: The identity of the thieves, and their motives, seemed fated to remain a mystery─until you arrived, bearing this ransom note.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: In it, the criminals state their price for the return of Her Grace's crown.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: And though it pains me to say it, I fear I have no choice but to acquiesce to their demands. Too much is at stake to do otherwise. The crown symbolizes Her Grace's birthright, and identifies her as the custodian of the Ul legacy. It must be recovered.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: I will travel to the Unholy Heir and pay them their ransom.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Though I am not foolish enough to meet these men alone as they stipulate, I dare not bring a host of my comrades lest the thieves take fright. Friend─would you consent to be present for the exchange?

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Mistress Momodi has always spoken of you in the most glowing terms, and I have never yet had reason to question her judgment.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: On behalf of all those still loyal to the sultana, I beseech you─help us in our hour of need.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Pray meet me at the Unholy Heir in central Thanalan, east of Black Brush Station. If the gods are good, the exchange will proceed without incident...

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“MANWIL007”?

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: I've come as agreed! Now, show me the crown!

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: Aye, you'll have your precious crown─once we've been duly compensated.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Do you think me a fool!? What assurance have I that you will honor your part of the agreement?

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: Now, now, Owyne...you're the least trustworthy man here. Not only was the crown stolen on your watch, but it looks to me as if you've violated the terms of our exchange. Did we not say that you were to come alone?

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: And given that you are not alone, what guarantee have we that there isn't a company of archers surrounding us even as we speak, ready to feather me and my men the moment they catch a glimpse of the crown?

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: You have made mock of our trust. The deal is off.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Wait! Here's your payment, as promised!

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> ...Aye, 'tis the real thing.

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! A thousand thanks to you, boy! You've succeeded where scores of thieves have failed!

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: And now, at long last, we have it! The power to create an army of undying soldiers─The Traders' Spurn!

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: No...no, it can't be! What have I done!?

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: Surely you must have wondered what it was that you were handing over─what it was that seemed as valuable to us as the crown seemed to you? Or did you assume we were feeling charitable?

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: Ah, but you must feel terrible, knowing that you've brought us the doom of Sil'dih. Worry not, boy─we'll grant you a quick death and spare you further ignominy.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: There's too many, Forename! Run! Run while you still can! I...I will do my duty.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: (-???-)It's your duty to serve the sultana, lad─and you'll be doing it for a good while yet!

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Sultansworn! Put these thieves to the sword and secure the crown!

dialogue.name: GARIBALD
dialogue.text: Sultansworn!? Hah! No matter! Kill them all!

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Master Papashan! But why...? How...?

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: The General saw you sneak into the vaults, Owyne.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: He suspected something was afoot and ordered us to keep an eye on you.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: The Flame General...? He ordered you to look after me?

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORM
dialogue.text: Master Papashan! More of them to the north!

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: After them, Sultansworn─they have the crown! This lot sought only to delay us!

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Let us speak again back in the city!

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: The source of herhis strength becomes clear...

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: You may have bested the golem, but you will not fare so well this day.

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: O mournful voice of creation! Send unto me a creature of the abyss, my thrall to command, that I may smite mine enemies!

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: Your very being imperils the plan. You cannot be suffered to live.

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: Unnngh... That the wisdom of the Paragons should be brought low...by mere mortals...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Paragons? This is indeed a disturbing revelation...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We had long suspected the involvement of the Bringers of Chaos─Ascians, to give them their true name.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But we could not be sure they were responsible for the recent disturbances until now. As if the sultanate needed any more enemies...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hm? Have we Sharlayans crossed paths with Ascians before? Well, we've certainly─ Wait. I don't recall telling you about my homeland.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, that's right─you're one of the gifted.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You know, this marks the third time I've found you in the midst of trouble. If I didn't know any better, I'd say you're a lodestone for it!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Anyway, I'm glad I started following you around. Who knows what grand conspiracy you'll stumble upon next!?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I jest, I jest... Had I truly been watching your every move, I wouldn't have taken so long to intervene in your latest altercation.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But all's well that ends well, eh? Our masked friend is no more, and while I very much doubt we've seen the last of his kind, his demise will likely grant us at least some respite. And on that note, I must away. Until next time, Forename.

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORMA
dialogue.text: Everyone is waiting for you, adventurer.

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORMA
dialogue.text: Pray do not keep my comrades waiting.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Does it surprise you to see me dressed so, Forename? I was once a Sultansworn, you know, though it's been fifteen years since I put down my sword, and took up the role of stationmaster.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: It is a capacity in which I am no less proud to serve, lest you doubt. Whenever Her Grace ventures outside the gates, I have the honor of protecting her person.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Never before had I seen her so despondent as when news of the crown's theft reached her ears.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: But thanks to your valiant efforts, she is returned to her former vibrant self. You have the gratitude of every Sultansworn, Forename.

dialogue.name: LADYSMAID
dialogue.text: Exalted vessel of Nald'thal, guardian of Thanalan, seventeenth ascendant to the throne of Ul'dah, Her Royal Majesty Nanamo Ul Namo presides!

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORM
dialogue.text: Long live Nanamo! Glory to the Sultana! Forever may she reign!

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORM
dialogue.text: Long live Nanamo! Glory to the Sultana! Forever may she reign!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: They regaled me with tales of a champion amongst champions, one whose tireless service to the crown merited the highest honor we might bestow.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Never did it occur to me that it might be you. Bring it forth!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Betokening our gratitude and esteem, I, Nanamo Ul Namo, Sultana of Ul'dah, confer upon you this gift.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Raubahn.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Your Grace.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: See to it that our champion is my personal guest at the banquet.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: As you command, Your Grace.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: If what they say is true, Ul'dah owes you a great debt.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Strange that we should not have met before this day...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: ...I sense we are kindred spirits.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I am not given to superstition, but I'll be sworn our tales belong in the same saga.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I am Raubahn Aldynn. With the consent of Her Grace, I oversee the affairs of the sultanate.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Brave souls are few and far between in these times. I count my blessings when I find one.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Her Grace invites you to join her at the coming banquet. I trust I will see you there.

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORM
dialogue.text: An honor indeed!

dialogue.name: SULTANSWORM
dialogue.text: Huzzah! Come, hero!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Until then.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: For the sake of Her Grace, and the glory of the sultanate, may you walk in the light of the Crystal.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: You have my thanks, Forename, for helping to defend Her Grace's good name, and for sparing the Sultansworn further dishonor. I believe Master Papashan would like to thank you personally.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Garibald the Fargone and his minions!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Fight for your sultana, boy! Fight for Ul'dah!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Yield or be slain, thief! I will not ask again!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
As you command, Master Papashan!
With me, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ugh...there are so many...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Old men shouldn't play with swords!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I will cut your heart out, old man!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Stand your ground, Sultansworn!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Is that a voidsent!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Meddlesome fools! You know not whom you face!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Hearken to me, denizen of the abyss!
Slay these interlopers and feast upon their souls!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Whatever happens, do not let them escape with the crown!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ugh...I have failed you...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The crown... We must...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I...I cannot...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forgive me, brothers...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the masked mage!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Soon, you shall take your vile gifts to the grave!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Mwahahaha!
Writhe as the venom eats its way through your veins!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: An unwelcome guest. No matter, all shall fall before me!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Whence springs this preternatural might!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You certainly have a knack for getting into trouble!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No mortal should possess such strength!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Keep it up, Forename!
We almost have him!
